markdown.markdown:
```{css, echo = FALSE} .justify { text-align: justify !important; text-indent: 20px; } .epigrafe { text-align: justify !important; text-indent: 20px; border: 1.5px solid #87c8b5; padding-top: 15px; padding-bottom: 5px; padding-right: 15px; padding-left: 15px; font-size: 14px; background-color: #f9f9f9; margin: 20px 0px 30px 0px; } ``` ::: {.justify} In this exploratory data analysis (EDA), we examine the time series data sets discussed in the [Data Visualization](https://mazuckerberg.georgetown.domains/DSAN_5600/4_data_visualization.html) section. The goal is to gain insight into the underlying components of the multiple time series. These analyses include trends, seasonality, variations, and periodic fluctuations. In addition, we will evaluate the time series for decomposition to see if it can be identified as multiplicative or additive. We will analyze the data sets using the following time series plots and tools: Lag plots, autocorrelation function (ACF) and partial autocorrelation function (PACF) analysis, stationarity checks using the Augmented Dickey-Fuller test, and Moving Average Smoothing for several periods of time. ::: Below are the libraries used in this section: ``` {r} #| echo: true #| message: false #| code-fold: true #| code-summary: "Libraries" #| results: 'hide' #| warning: false library(tidyverse) library(ggplot2) library(forecast) library(astsa) library(xts) library(tseries) library(fpp2) library(fma) library(lubridate) library(tidyverse) library(TSstudio) library(quantmod) library(tidyquant) library(plotly) library(ggplot2) library(gridExtra) library(readxl) library(imputeTS) ``` ### Global Oil Production ::: {.justify} The following plot, shows the data for the top 15 oil-producing countries in 2022. The goal is to use a line plot to show the evolution of the global oil market over the last 22 years and identify the dynamic leaders. Throughout this project, our central focus will be on the United States, which has been the leading country in oil production since 2018. ::: ``` {=html}
```
> [Exploratory Data Analisis - U.S Oil Production by Year](https://mazuckerberg.georgetown.domains/DSAN_5600/5_EDA/5_oil_production_year.html) ::: {.justify} A first analysis was done by year. It's important to analyze the monthly data to understand changes in trends and to assess the presence of seasonality or cycles. ::: > [Exploratory Data Analisis - U.S Oil Production by Month](https://mazuckerberg.georgetown.domains/DSAN_5600/5_EDA/5_oil_production_month.html) ### Crude Oil Price ::: {.justify} Price is a key characteristic to analyze in order to understand the behavior of a product in the market. One relevant dataset that has been included is the price of crude oil. An extensive exploratory data analysis of the daily price of crude oil was developed to gain insight into market fluctuations and trends from a time series perspective. ::: > [Exploratory Data Analisis - Crude Oil Price by Year](https://mazuckerberg.georgetown.domains/DSAN_5600/5_EDA/5_oil_price_year.html) > [Exploratory Data Analisis - Crude Oil Price by Month](https://mazuckerberg.georgetown.domains/DSAN_5600/5_EDA/5_oil_price_month.html) ### Bus Passenger Trips ::: {.justify} Description. ::: > [Exploratory Data Analisis - Bus Passenger Trips](https://mazuckerberg.georgetown.domains/DSAN_5600/5_EDA/5_bus_passengers.html)

The goal is to gain insight into the underlying components of the multiple time series. These analyses include trends, seasonality, variations, and periodic fluctuations. In addition, we will evaluate the time series for decomposition to see if it can be identified as multiplicative or additive. We will analyze the data sets using the following time series plots and tools: Lag plots, autocorrelation function (ACF) and partial autocorrelation function (PACF) analysis, stationarity checks using the Augmented Dickey-Fuller test, and Moving Average Smoothing for several periods of time. ::: Below are the libraries used in this section: ``` {r} #| echo: true #| message: false #| code-fold: true #| code-summary: "Libraries" #| results: 'hide' #| warning: false library(tidyverse) library(ggplot2) library(forecast) library(astsa) library(xts) library(tseries) library(fpp2) library(fma) library(lubridate) library(tidyverse) library(TSstudio) library(quantmod) library(tidyquant) library(plotly) library(ggplot2) library(gridExtra) library(readxl) library(imputeTS) ``` ### Global Oil Production ::: {.justify} The following plot, shows the data for the top 15 oil-producing countries in 2022. The goal is to use a line plot to show the evolution of the global oil market over the last 22 years and identify the dynamic leaders. Throughout this project, our central focus will be on the United States, which has been the leading country in oil production since 2018. ::: ``` {=html}
```

One relevant dataset that has been included is the price of crude oil. An extensive exploratory data analysis of the daily price of crude oil was developed to gain insight into market fluctuations and trends from a time series perspective. ::: > [Exploratory Data Analisis - Crude Oil Price by Year](https://mazuckerberg.georgetown.domains/DSAN_5600/5_EDA/5_oil_price_year.html) > [Exploratory Data Analisis - Crude Oil Price by Month](https://mazuckerberg.georgetown.domains/DSAN_5600/5_EDA/5_oil_price_month.html) ### Bus Passenger Trips ::: {.justify} Description. ::: > [Exploratory Data Analisis - Bus Passenger Trips](https://mazuckerberg.georgetown.domains/DSAN_5600/5_EDA/5_bus_passengers.html)
